title: Business Live: Sterling stumbles on political uncertainty - BBC News
summary: ex-yahoo boss sorry for data breach .
m & s slows food store rollout .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for today - thanks very much for reading .
please do join us bright and early tomorrow when the live page kicks off at 06:00 uk time .

documents.title: 'incomes have n't recovered in uk '
text: these charts from the institute for fiscal studies make for sober reading - whether you 're a baby boomer or a millennial .
two charts from new @ twitterid report a stark reminder of how grim the last recession was for national income and earnings .
and they have n't recovered
i think the former drives the latter but take care as the chart only goes to year 3 so ~2011/12 .
we 're still in a recession in the north , gdp gains are not really going anywhere other than london and south east

documents.title: wall street sets new high score
text: us stocks have finished at fresh record highs , helped by strong gains for apple and video games makers .
the s & p 500 finished 0.14 % higher at 2,594 points - a new record .
the dow jones index was up 6 points to 23,563 , while the tech-heavy nasdaq gained 0.3 % to 6,789 points .
apple gained 0.8 % at $ 176.24 a share , giving it a market valuation of more than $ 900bn .
video game maker take-two interactive software jumped 11 % after it gave a stronger-than-expected revenue forecast for the holiday quarter .

documents.title: millennials vs baby boomers ? bbc business is asking for your views on how the generations have fared
text: millennials v baby boomers ?
or do we have more in common than we think ?
we 're looking to interview a family about which generation is better off .
please follow @ twitterid & dm your details # archive
baby boomers
does anyone ever ask about how generation x is struggling losing jobs in our 40s ?

documents.title: feeling festiveonly 47 days to go
text: the uk 's toy retailers are hoping for plenty of presents under the tree this year .
they 've seen sales fall by 2 % in the first nine months of 2017 and are holding out for a busy christmas to make up for it .
the slowdown has been partly due to an income squeeze on shoppers , according to industry bosses .
analysts and retailers expect a flat full year at best for the industry following two consecutive years of rapid growth .
read the full story here .

documents.title: which firms are ranked worst for female executives ?
text: a closely-watched government review has urged some of the uk 's biggest companies to do more to to recruit women into senior positions .

the hampton-alexander review found that although many bigger companies are making progress , as a whole the uk 's 350 largest listed firms still need to fill at least 40 % of top jobs with women in the next three years .
that 's to hit a target of one in three board positions being held by women by 2020 .
of the companies in the ftse 100 , it found that these two companies were among the lowest ranked for women on boards and in leadership :
while this high street retailer was ranked first among companies on the uk 's 100 share index .

documents.title: would trump win again ? the bookmaker 's view - by bbc news reporter owen amos
text: having lost more than $ 4m by paying out early on a hillary clinton victory last year , irish bookmaker paddy power now has its very own head of trump betting , joe lee .
in a hypothetical election - trump v hillary part two - where would he place his money ?
`` oh , i 'd absolutely go with trump , '' he says .
`` no question or doubt about it . ''
like the professors and pollsters , the bookmaker thinks mr trump 's chances are `` all down to the calibre of candidate the democrats roll out '' .
paddy power has taken money on - among others - mark zuckerberg and oprah winfrey , while the hawaiian congresswoman tulsi gabbard has been backed into 20/1 .
for now , though , mr trump is calling the shots .
the bad news for the president ?
paddy power has him 5/4 to be impeached - down from 9/4 before the special counsel 's indictments .
to read more , click here .

documents.title: one year on from trump win
text: it 's a year to the day that donald trump pulled off the election victory that stunned the world .
he ran on a platform of turbo-charged economic growth , `` america first '' trade deals and a return of us manufacturing jobs .
but has he delivered on any of those promises ?
this documentary - which has been running on bbc world service and radio 4 - looks at how successful he 's been so far
has president trump delivered on the economic promises he made during the election campaign ?

documents.title: 'sterling likely to remain weak '
text: back to the markets , and as you can see from the chart , the pound stumbled today .

analysts suggested the loss of the brexit-supporting minister priti patel was a test of mrs may 's authority , and provided further obstacles for the government ahead of brexit talks later this week .

`` despite the political headlines , markets have n't yet started pricing in a change in government , '' said yassir benjelloun touimi , a portfolio manager at dalton strategic partnership in london .
`` ( but ) unless there is clarity on the brexit situation , sterling should remain weak , '' he said .
at one point the pound fell 0.6 % to $ 1.3096 - inching closer to the one-month low of $ 1.3040 it hit on friday - before paring some of those losses .

documents.title: may loses second cabinet minister in a week
text: priti patel stepped down as international development secretary a short moment ago after a meeting with theresa may in downing street .
you can see her resignation letter below .

the prime minister has said it was `` right '' ms patel resigned , after further information came to light about her meetings with israeli politicians , according to the bbc 's political editor , laura kuenssberg .
ms patel is the second minister to leave the cabinet in the space of a week , after defence secretary michael fallon quit over his past behaviour .
the political uncertainty around mrs may 's government has weighed on the pound , contributing to a fall against other major currencies today .
pm 's response to priti patel : it is right you have decided to resign ''

documents.title: send facebook your naked
text: seriously .
facebook is piloting an initiative in australia designed to combat revenge porn , the guardian reports .
users who are worried about former partners putting up sexual images online for revenge are being encouraged to send in their home-made porn and nude to facebook .
the images will then be `` hashed '' - converted into a digital `` fingerprint '' - so that attempts to upload the same image to facebook , instagram or messenger can then be blocked .

given facebook 's record on privacy - particularly when it gets in the way of facebook 's business model - this initiative is quite a logical extension of the social media giant 's relentless quest for user information .
the business live page wonders - what kind of ads will be served to the people who decide to take facebook up on its offer ?
author: Tom Espiner
Business reporter

documents.title: has uk clamped down on tax avoidance ?
text: the role of uk island territories , and the naming of high-profile british names in the paradise papers leak has shone the spotlight on tax avoidance in the uk .
in response , the government said hmrc has raised an extra £ 160bn from tackling tax avoidance - a figure that labour has disputed .
reality checks looks at whether the numbers add up
has the exchequer had an extra £ 160bn since 2010 as a result of hmrc clamping down on tax avoidance ?
no is the simple answer .
mainly future projections .
reality check !
such right wing bias & protection is rarely rooted in 'reality '

documents.title: trump 'will struggle to cut china deficit '
text: donald trump arrived in beijing earlier for his first state visit to china since he entered the white house .
on the campaign trail and at times in office , he has railed against america 's huge trade deficit with china .
but david dollar , a senior fellow at the brookings institution 's china centre and a former us treasury emissary to china , says it wo n't be easy to narrow that deficit .
# trump will struggle to cut $ 300bn+ trade deficit with as it distracts him with headline making deals @ twitterid tells @ twitterid # trumpinchina
everything is a distraction with him

documents.title: fashion forward
text: more on the changes at the top of lvmh , where sidney toledano is replacing pierre-yves roussel as head of lvmh fashion group .
the chief executives of celine , givenchy , loewe , pucci , kenzo , marc jacobs , rossimoda and nicholas kirkwood will all report to him .
meanwhile , mr roussel , who headed the fashion group for a decade , is to become a special advisor to lvmh chairman bernard arnault .
all the appointments will take effect from the beginning of next year .

documents.title: shake-up at christian dior
text: big news in the fashion world .
christian dior chief executive sidney toledano is stepping down after nearly 20 years at the helm of the french fashion giant .
fendi boss , pietro beccari , who took the italian brand further upmarket and helped it top €1bn in sales last year , is being propelled to the top of dior to take his place .
mr toledano is taking on a broader role at parent company lvmh in a reshuffle at the fashion and luxury goods firm .

documents.title: bidder walks away from weinstein company
text: a us private equity firm is understood to have dropped its interest in the film production company co-founded by harvey weinstein , raising questions about the studio 's future .
colony capital , founded by thomas j barrack jr - a friend of president donald trump - is no longer interested in buying the weinstein company , the bbc understands .
last month , colony entered a preliminary deal with the embattled firm .
at the time , though , mr barrack compared the studio to a `` patient that 's dying on the table '' .
the weinstein company , which was behind oscar-winning films including the king 's speech , has come under intense pressure over the sexual allegations against mr weinstein .

documents.title: jailed libor trader wins stay on city ban
text: tom hayes , the first individual to be jailed in the libor fixing scandal , has welcomed a decision to look further into his possible ban by the financial conduct authority ( fca ) .
the fca said it planned to prohibit mr hayes from `` performing any function in relation to any regulated activity in the financial industry '' - but that he has appealed the decision .
the city regulator said : `` mr hayes has referred the fca 's decision to the upper tribunal .
therefore , the decision has not taken effect pending the determination by the tribunal . ''

documents.title: britain 's offshore empire
text: the huge growth of the offshore finance industry , highlighted by the paradise papers leak , was the unforeseen result of an `` accounting device '' created by britain , writes bbc economics correspondent andy verity .
how offshore rose like a phoenix from the ashes of the british empire - by a book-keeping accident # paradisepapers

documents.title: patel faces may meeting
text: priti patel - the cabinet minister in the middle of a storm over controversial meetings with israeli ministers - is back in the uk and preparing to meet theresa may to find out her future .
she was ordered back from uganda by the prime minister - and , amid intense media interest , landed a short while ago at heathrow (
the controversy has raised questions about the stability of mrs may 's government , with analysts saying this has weighed on the pound .

`` sellers have exploited the unsettling combination of political uncertainty in the uk and lingering concerns over the brexit negotiations to attack the british pound , '' said lukman otunuga , a research analyst at fxtm in london .
you can follow live updates on ms patel 's situation here .

documents.title: ftse edges higher
text: the uk 's 100 share index has finished in positive territory , as gains for tobacco and energy stocks outweighed losses for housebuilders .
the ftse 100 ended 16.6 points - or 0.2 % - higher at 7,529.72 after fluctuating between gains and losses .

documents.title: the growth of carluccio 's
text: antonio carluccio became a household name , largely thanks to the italian restaurant chain he co-founded with his ex-wife priscilla .
the restaurant - known for its pasta dishes and pannetone cakes - started in central london in 1999 before expanding in the south east and then later to other parts of the uk .
it was listed on the uk stock market in 2005 , when antonio and priscilla ( seen above with her brother terrence conran ) cashed in most of their stake in the business .
the chain kept the carluccio name - and retained links with the chef , who also found success with his cookery books and tv show two greedy italians .
it was bought in 2010 for £ 90m by a middle eastern retail and leisure group , and now has nearly 100 restaurants across the uk , from aberdeen to woking .

documents.title: carluccio 's pays tribute
text: the `` godfather of italian cooking '' antonio carluccio , who died this morning aged 80 , will be `` greatly missed '' , says the restaurant chain which bears his name .
he was an obe in the uk , had an order of merit in italy , and was a much loved and respected italian cookery writer , cook , restaurateur , food expert and tv personality , the company says .
we are incredibly saddened by the news that antonio carluccio passed away today .
he was a huge inspiration to us & his energy & sense of humour will be greatly missed .
sadly missed .

he was a lovely nonno ''

documents.title: 'russian agents hacked yahoo ' - mayer
text: former yahoo boss marissa mayer has blamed russian agents for two massive data breaches at the internet company which affected billions of accounts .

`` as ceo , these thefts occurred during my tenure , and i want to sincerely apologise to each and every one of our users , '' she told the senate commerce committee at a hearing on the growing number of incidents involving major us companies .

`` unfortunately , while all our measures helped yahoo successfully defend against the barrage of attacks by both private and state-sponsored hackers , russian agents intruded on our systems and stole our users ' data . ''
yahoo 's new owner verizon disclosed last month that the 2013 and 2014 data breaches affected all 3 billion of yahoo 's accounts .

documents.title: breakingchef antonio carluccio dies
text: celebrity chef and restaurateur antonio carluccio has died at the age of 80 .
a statement from the italian chef 's agent said : `` it is with great sadness that we announce that commendatore antonio carluccio obe sadly passed away this morning . ''
the italian restaurant chain carluccio 's - which he co-founded with his wife priscilla and other investors in 1999 - has 96 sites in the uk .

documents.title: christmas crunch
text: as we reported earlier , marks and spencer has announced it will open fewer food stores than expected due to a slowdown in sales .
fresh from covering the firm 's results , the daily telegraph 's retail editor has done some important market research .
the m & s kpis everyone really cares about : the christmas sandwich : 8/10 .

documents.title: what 's causing the political uncertainty ?
text: analysts have suggested that the pound is struggling because of fresh uncertainty facing theresa may 's government .

the prime minister replaced her defence secretary , michael fallon , last week and commentators including the bbc 's political editor laura kuennsberg suggested she may be about to lose another cabinet minister .
the future of international development secretary priti patel ( is in doubt following controversy over her meetings with israeli officials .
ms patel has been ordered back from africa by the prime minister , and laura kuenssberg said ms patel 's sacking seemed `` almost inevitable now '' .

`` the possibility that may may have to sack another minister today does lead to another wave of speculation about the relative weakness of her government , '' said jane foley , senior currency strategist at rabobank , adding that these developments would weigh on sterling .

he 's pointed to the issues around eu citizens ' rights , northern ireland and the uk 's financial commitments

documents.title: slow start for us stocks
text: wall street has slipped at the start of trading , as the earning season winds down and investors focus on the debate on capitol hill about tax cuts .
the dow jones industrial average is down 0.2 % to 23,511 points , after finishing at a fresh record on tuesday .
the wider s & p 500 index and the tech-heavy nasdaq composite are down slightly too .
there 's continued speculation that a plan to cut corporate tax rates - which has helped to boost us stock markets in recent weeks - will be watered down by republicans .

documents.title: pound drops
text: the pound 's slide from this morning has continued .
it 's now fallen back below $ 1.31 and €1.13 , dropping more than 0.5 % against both currencies .
analysts pointed to uncertainty around theresa may 's cabinet , and fresh brexit meetings in brussels tomorrow and on friday , for the volatility in sterling .

documents.title: pay rises speeding up
text: british employers are having to raise pay offers to bring in new staff and counter a growing shortage of eu workers ahead of brexit , the uk 's recruitment and employment confederation said .
the group , which represents recruitment firms , said a monthly survey indicated starting salaries for the month of october rose at the second-quickest pace in two years .
`` we already know that eu workers are leaving because of the uncertainties they are facing right now , '' rec chief executive kevin green said .
`` we therefore need clarity around what future immigration systems will look like .
otherwise , the situation will get worse and employers will face even more staff shortages . ''

documents.title: a contradiction ?
text: as we reported earlier , monarch airlines has lost its high court battle over `` valuable '' runway slots it wanted to exchange with other carriers .
however not everyone agrees with the high court that the collapsed airline is n't entitled to sell such intangible assets .

`` it is a contradiction that once an airline goes into administration it loses the right to trade these slots , given that the primary purpose of administration is to maintain the business as a going concern , '' said henry kikoyo , a partner at brown rudnick .

documents.title: pressure on eu car firms to curb emissions
text: the european commission has published proposals aimed at reducing vehicles ' carbon dioxide ( co2 ) emissions by 2030 .
the move is designed to put further pressure on manufacturers to develop more hybrid and electric cars .
the commission also wants to introduce an incentive scheme to encourage companies to produce more zero and low-emission cars .

documents.title: snap , crackle , pop ?
text: it 's not looking too good for snap : shares are down more than 12 % in pre-market trading in new york .
the company made its market debut in march , but the stock has sunk close to 40 % since then , closing at $ 15.12 last night .
the snapchat owner popped 44 % in their first day of trading , leaving the shares worth $ 24.48 at the end of their first day having been priced at $ 17 .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: theresa may waxwork unveiled
text: madame tussauds has at last unveiled a waxwork of theresa may .
the figure of the prime minister wears a red suit by british designer amanda wakeley - the outfit she wore on election night , and for her first meeting with president trump .
the waxwork will be displayed on the downing street set of the london attraction , next to many other world leaders .

documents.title: monarch loses slots battle
text: monarch airlines has lost its high court battle over `` valuable '' runway slots it wanted to exchange with other carriers to raise cash for creditors .
the airline ceased trading last month and its administrators ' lawyers called the slots its `` most valuable asset '' .
the company which allocates 39 airports ' slots accepted that monarch would have received some of them if it had not gone into administration .
wizz air and easyjet are among airlines who are interested in acquiring them .

documents.title: fire fighting
text: telegraph retail editor ashley armstrong has been listening to m & s boss steve rowe this morning
while her times counterpart deirdre hipwell has been tweeting on the retailer 's chairman archie norman :
norman 's speech impressive & he is clearly making his presence felt at m & s which finally is facing up to the need for dramatic change
m & s boss steve rowe has been putting out fires .
reckons the retailer can become special again ''
but apart from that , a great business
but otherwise everything at m & s was good , right ?
only those minor issues to tackle

documents.title: merger 'wo n't hurt fair prices '
text: peter terium , chief executive of npower owner innogy , says that competitive prices should persist following the npower-sse merger so long as there are `` at least two and maybe three or four '' big suppliers in the uk energy market .
as well as the big six , there are dozens of other smaller suppliers available to consumers .
earlier today , sse said it will merge its british domestic business with npower in a move that would take out one of the big players .
mr terium said an energy price cap is not the reason for the merger , but that it `` might have pushed it a bit quicker '' .

documents.title: google promoted 'fake tweets '
text: google says it is `` not happy '' , after its ranking algorithm caused fake tweets to be promoted on the search engine .
the algorithm promoted a carousel of posts that were `` popular on twitter '' , and some of the tweets included false information about texas gunman devin patrick kelley , who killed 26 people .
the fake tweets included false stories claiming that kelley was a member of a pro-bernie sanders group , that he had converted to islam and that he was a `` radical alt-left '' activist .

google 's public liaison for search danny sullivan said that the search engine wants to `` get this right '' , and that changes had been made to the algorithm following a similar incident with its top stories section following the las vegas shooting .
google promoted texas gunman fake tweets

it 's almost like nobody is omniscient and ca n't meaningfully filter information in real time , and those who aspire or claim to the ability are liars and ministries of truth that would make things even worse .
yes , but the fact you ca n't even flag a search result as fake news is annoying
brigading is a problem .
you 'd have troll farms flagging legit news to help make actual fake news the only thing people can see .
only if google actually believed the brigades
they believe them on youtube .
if targeted for prevention , becomes an arms race .
even w/o brigading , we 'd be deciding official reality by consensus .
i 'm worried .
fake news - this has already been debunked by @ twitterid

documents.title: 'europe needs agreement ' on taxing
text: french finance minister bruno le maire says europe needs an agreement on taxing multinational firms like apple , google and amazon within the next two years .
the comments come after the paradise papers showed apple has a secretive new structure that would enable it to continue avoiding billions in taxes .
the papers revealed how apple sidestepped a 2013 crackdown on its controversial irish tax practices by shopping around for a tax haven .
the tech giant then moved the firm holding most of its untaxed offshore cash , now $ 252bn ( £ 192bn ) , to the channel island of jersey .

documents.title: china 's tencent buys stake in snapchat owner
text: china internet giant tencent has bought a 12 % stake in snapchat 's owner , snap .
tencent , which owns popular messaging platform wechat purchased 145.8m non-voting shares in snap - giving it a 12 % stake .
this is n't the first time the china tech company has invested in the social media company , having participated in private investment rounds in 2012 and 2013 .
analysts may view the move positively after snap posted a disappointing trading update and said that it would be overhauling the message-disappearing app 's design .

documents.title: oil prices steady
text: oil prices have steadied as chinese crude imports fell to a one-year low , but losses were offset by investor caution over rising political tensions in the middle east .
brent crude is now up 0.1 % to $ 63.77 a barrel , while west texas intermediate is down 0.2 % at $ 57.11 a barrel .

brent crude hit $ 64.65 earlier this week , its highest since mid-2015 , as political tensions in the middle east escalated after a sweeping anti-corruption purge in top crude exporter saudi arabia , which in turn has confronted iran over the conflict in yemen .

documents.title: hermes revenues up
text: luxury goods maker hermes reported further sales growth in the third quarter , driven by higher demand for ready-to-wear and accessories , silk and textiles , and perfumes business lines in all regions .
hermes said its revenues were up by 6.4 % in the period from july to september , while sales increased by 11.3 % .
`` we 're continuing to deliver a robust performance and particularly healthy growth , because it 's organic growth , '' said chief executive axel dumas .
`` it 's a very good quarter . ''

documents.title: sterling weakens
text: the pound traded 0.4 % lower against the dollar at $ 1.3123 .
sterling also fell versus the euro , dropping 0.4 % to just over €1.13 .

documents.title: bribery scheme
text: three former rolls-royce employees have pleaded guilty to us charges that they orchestrated international bribes at the firm for over a decade .
the charges , unsealed by the department of justice , relate to efforts made to secure a contract to supply equipment and services to power a gas pipeline from central asia to china .

the indictment mentions the two former rolls-royce executives , a former rolls-royce employee , a former intermediary for rolls-royce in kazakhstan and an executive of an international engineering consulting firm .

in pleading guilty , the three former employees admitted that they each participated in a conspiracy to engage commercial advisors who would use their commission payments from rolls-royce to bribe foreign officials in a number of countries to help rolls-royce secure an improper advantage and obtain and retain business with foreign governments and instrumentalities across the globe .

documents.title: losers and winners
text: shares of home builder persimmon fell 3.6 % on the ftse 100 index after it issued a trading update that disappointed investors .
meanwhile , food-to-fashion group associated british foods fell for a second day , losing 2.1 % after it said it expected profits at its sugar unit to fall in the current financial year .

shares of rolls-royce tumbled 8.5 % after us authorities unveiled criminal charges against individuals accused of involvement in a bribery scheme to help the engineering company secure energy contracts in kazakhstan .
imperial brands gained the most on the index , rising 2.1 % after the tobacco company said it planned to step up its vaping strategy , eclipsing an earnings miss .
international private hospital group mediclinic , the second biggest gainer on the gauge , added 1.9 % .

documents.title: sse contributing to consumers
text: apart from the merger , sse has also announced that it will make a voluntary contribution of £ 65.1 million to consumers .
`` this decision follows a review by sse of its performance under ofgem 's riio-t1 ( electricity transmission ) price control and discussions with ofgem , '' said the energy watchdog .
`` network companies require a licence to operate , not just from the regulator , but from their own customers who must be confident they are getting good value for money .
`` we would welcome other network companies to take similar steps by making voluntary contributions to consumers . ''

documents.title: more transparency needed
text: latest revelations from the paradise papers reveal that prince charles campaigned to alter climate-change agreements without disclosing his private estate had an offshore financial interest in what he was promoting .

`` it 's interesting in that prince charles did n't make any public speeches about amending the kyoto protocol and another international climate change agreement until after the investment had been made , prompted by the recommendation of a close personal friend , '' sir alistair graham , a former chairman of the committee on standards in public life told the victoria derbyshire show .
`` it raises a question mark about the link between the investors and the lobbyists .

`` but my question is , if a member of the royal family wishes to lobby for changes in public policy , then i think they need to apply the rules that apply to all public officials - they have to declare all financial interest in the area they 're lobbying in . ''
author: Victoria Derbyshire

documents.title: luxurious flying
text: frequent flyers want to experience the same sort of comfort in the air that they have access to on the ground , whether it 's bigger windows , more comfortable seats or more expansive in-flight entertainment .
airlines need to take note of the latest market research and work to improve the flying experience , ingo wuggetzer , vice president of cabin innovation and design at airbus told bbc business live .
`` there should be a seamless transition if you 're at home , at work , or on an aircraft , '' mr wuggetzer said .
many airlines have been squeezing smaller seats into planes .
the aircraft interiors industry is worth $ 17bn ( £ 12.9bn ) .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: e.on losing customers
text: energy supplier e.on announced at a press conference on wednesday that it has so far lost about 200,000 customers in the uk , according to its chief financial officer marc spieker .

mr spieker added that the group was strong enough to compete on its own in britain , adding it currently did not examine strategic options after rivals npower and sse said they would merge to become a new independent retail company .

documents.title: new design for snapchat
text: snapchat 's owner is set to overhaul the disappearing messaging app 's design after posting lackluster user growth and sales .

chief executive evan spiegel said the transition wo n't be smooth , but that the tech company is `` willing to take that risk '' for what it believes are substantial long-term benefits to its business .
snapchat is struggling to attract new users and boost ad revenues amid an increasingly competitive social media space .

`` when you have to put out a statement denying rumours you 're shutting down within a year that 's when you know things are n't going particularly well '' , said dave lee , bbc north america technology reporter .

documents.title: sse shares rise
text: sse 's shares are on the rise following news that one of the uk 's `` big six '' energy providers is to merge with rival npower .
sse 's shares have jumped 3.7 % to trade at £ 14.59 .

documents.title: efficiency and affordability
text: as we reported earlier , sse is to merge with rival npower to form a new independent uk energy company .
tony keeling , sse 's chief operating officer , says that talks have been ongoing for `` well over a year '' , and are not influenced by recent financial results .
`` we 've listened to government regulators and customers , and understand that the market needs to transform , '' he told the today programme .

`` we 're absolutely committed to doing that , and by merging sse 's retail business with npower 's retail business to form a new organisation , we think we can be more efficient , more agile and more innovative for customers .
`` efficiency is an issue , and customers want bills to be more affordable , and by bringing the two companies together , there 's an opportunity for us to make things for efficient . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: more space to tweet
text: twitter has rolled out plans to increase the number of characters in tweets from 140 to 280 for most of its users worldwide .
the move comes in response to criticism that it was not easy enough to tweet .
its efforts may be paying off .
last month the tech company said it may turn a profit in the fourth quarter - after 11 years and £ 1.9bn in losses - as it narrowed losses and added users .

documents.title: toyota shares rise after revised forecast
text: shares in japanese car maker toyota ended the trading day 1 % higher , after it upgraded its profit forecast on tuesday .
it now expects profits for the full year to be 1.95 trillion yen ( $ 17bn ; £ 12.9bn ) , after a previous forecast of 1.83tn yen of annual net income .
other winners in japan include sony whose shares rose 2.8 % , while panasonic stock climbed 2 % .
in spite of those gains , tokyo 's nikkei 225 index closed slightly lower , down 0.1 % or 23.78 points to end the trading day at 22,913.82 .
on tuesday , the nikkei 225 stock average reached its highest close since january 1992 .
australia 's asx200 finished flat , just 2 points or 0.03 % higher at 6,016.30 .
the shanghai composite climbed 0.06 % or 1.89 points higher at 3,415.46 .
hong kong 's hang seng was down 88.08 points or 0.3 % , closing at 28,906.26 .
author: Ashleigh Nghiem
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: 'groundhog day '
text: it 's `` groundhog day '' for marks and spencer , one analyst says .
`` m & s has n't found the magic formula , '' patrick o'brien , uk research director at globaldata retail told the today programme .
`` it 's like groundhog day .
the same questions are being asked in regards to how they sort out their womenswear proposition . ''
the central question is whether or not they 'll be able to transition to appealing to youth , whilst keeping other markets happy .
o'brien fears that this may be `` too difficult '' for the troubled retailer .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: london opens up
text: in london , the ftse 100 index opened slightly higher at 7,522.03 , up 8.9 points or 0.12 % .
meanwhile , the ftse 250 is also up 20,325.30 , up 18.2 points or 0.09 % .

documents.title: will sky news close ?
text: sky has threatened to shut down sky news if the news channel proves to be a major obstacle in its takeover bid by rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox .

`` there are lots of people saying this is sabre-rattling that this is a way of saying , let this deal with fox go through or the puppy gets it , so for that reason we should be skeptical and call rupert murdoch 's bluff , '' amol rajan , the bbc 's media editor told the today programme .
`` but against that , there is this sheer raw commercial factor .

`` sky news loses tens of millions of pounds every year , and it 's perfectly reasonable that the independent directors of sky , which is where this latest news has come from , would say , 'you know what , if we were forced to choose , we would rather this merger with 21st century fox went through because it makes sense during a tremendously difficult time in the tv industry , than to continue to fund the losses . ' ''
author: Amol Rajan
Media editor

documents.title: sse to merge with npower
text: sse has announced that it will merge with npower to for a new independent uk energy company .

`` the scale of change in the energy market means we believe a separation of our household energy and services business and the proposed merger with npower will enable both entities to focus more acutely on pursuing their own dedicated strategies , and will ultimately better serve customers , employees and other stakeholders , '' said sse 's chief executive alistair phillips-davies .

`` sse will remain a balanced group of related businesses , specialising in the energy , infrastructure and services needed to support the transition to a lower carbon future , but continuing to serve business and irish customers ; whilst the demerged retail business will build on a history of operational excellence and first-class customer service to pursue its own dynamic strategy for gb customers . ''

documents.title: wetherspoon 's sales up
text: pub chain jd wetherspoon has reported that like-for-like sales are up 6.1 % and total sales are up 4.3 % , for the 13 weeks until 29 october 2017 .
expectations for full-year operating margin are unchanged , and the chain currently anticipates a trading outcome for the current financial year in line with its expectations .

documents.title: bid for weinstein studio pulled
text: colony capital has apparently ended talks to potentially buy the weinstein company .

the new york times reports that private equity firm colony capital , run by thomas barrack jr , has ended talks with the struggling studio to buy some or all of its assets , according to the newspaper .

while several television and film partners have cut ties with producer harvey weinstein as allegations of sexual assault against him mount , the newspaper reports that the talks have ended due to the parties disagreeing on pricing .
in part , the acquisition effort broke down because of colony 's desire to structure any purchase in a way that would not enrich mr. weinstein .

documents.title: sse adjusted pre-tax profits down
text: energy supplier sse 's adjusted pre-tax profits for the six months to 30 september 2017 are down 13.9 % to £ 409.6m .

`` the operating environment continues to present a number of complex challenges to manage , with significant political and regulatory intervention an ongoing feature of the energy sector , '' said sse 's chairman richard gillingwater .
`` sse is focused , resilient and adaptable and those qualities continue to stand the company in good stead in responding to such interventions and other key changes . ''

documents.title: marks and spencer cfo steps down
text: marks and spencer group has announced that its chief financial officer helen weir has stepped down , amidst news that the retailer 's pretax profits are down 5.3 % .
ms weir will continue in her role until a suitable successor has been found .

documents.title: nissan cuts annual profit forecast
text: japanese car maker nissan motors has trimmed its full-year profit forecast following a safety inspection scandal which led to a big recall in its home market .
the firm expects operating profit of 645bn yen ( $ 5.7bn ; £ 4.3bn ) for the year to march 2018 , down 6 % from previous guidance of 685bn yen .
it also posted a sharp drop in operating profit for the three months to september .
last month nissan recalled 1.2m cars in the domestic market after failing to conduct proper safety checks .
despite the lower forecast , nissan motors ' shares were nearly 0.7 % higher in afternoon trading in tokyo .
author: Ashleigh Nghiem
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: passenger row
text: india 's biggest airline indigo apologised to a passenger after video emerged of him being tackled by staff .
the video released on monday allegedly shows indigo staff manhandling the passenger on the delhi airport tarmac last month .
it has sparked public outcry on social media and has been televised widely on local news channels .

documents.title: customers 'have choice '
text: energy supplier sse says it has been in talks with the owner of rival npower with a view to forming a new uk energy company , which would bring together two of the uk 's `` big six '' gas and electricity suppliers .
`` there 's really strong competition in the energy market .
in the past two years we 've seen the number of energy suppliers double - there 's now about 60 , '' claire osborne , an energy expert with uswitch.com told wake up to money .
`` there are a lot of good deals out there for customers - they do n't need to rely on the big six to get a good deal and get a good service .
`` i think that there are great options out there whether this merger goes ahead . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: falling sales
text: marks and spencer is to release its half year results , and is expected to announce another fall in profits and more store closures due to poor sales , tough trading conditions and the falling value of sterling .

`` i suspect that the focus of today is not so much going to be on those first-half results because they 're backward looking , '' grace peters , global investment strategist at jp morgan private bank told wake up to money .

`` i think the market very much wants to focus on the turnaround plan being executed at marks and spencer , and specifically are hoping for tougher new targets shaped by the chairman archie norman , who 's just been on the board for the past few months . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to wednesday on business live .
coming up today - marks and spencer will be releasing its half year profits .
the retailer is expected to announce more store closures due to poor sales , falling profits and tough trading conditions .
there will also be more on energy suppliers sse and npower considering merging to form a new uk energy company .
later today , the european commission is to announce new limits for co2 emissions , which will come into force in the eu in 2025 .

finally , discussions will continue over the paradise papers revelations , paricularly the news that prince charles lobbied to change climate policy without disclosing that the duchy of cornwall had an offshore financial interest in what he was promoting .
stay with us for that and all the rest of the business news as it breaks .
